# colorPixelFormat

**Instance Property**

The Metal pixel format for the renderer’s color output.

## Declaration

```swift
var colorPixelFormat: MTLPixelFormat { get }
```

## Discussion

Use this property, along with the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/depthPixelFormat] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRenderer/stencilPixelFormat] properties, if you perform custom drawing with Metal (see the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneRendererDelegate] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNodeRendererDelegate] classes) and need to create a new [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Metal/MTLRenderPipelineState] object to change the GPU state as part of your rendering.



## Customizing Scene Rendering with Metal

- **currentRenderCommandEncoder**: The Metal render command encoder in use for the current SceneKit rendering pass.
- **device**: The Metal device this renderer uses for rendering.
- **commandQueue**: The Metal command queue this renderer uses for rendering.
- **depthPixelFormat**: The Metal pixel format for the renderer’s depth buffer.
- **stencilPixelFormat**: The Metal pixel format for the renderer’s stencil buffer.
